text:
While Snapchat will not
notify you of being blocked,

if you have the suspicion
that someone blocked you,
there are a few ways to tell
that you have most likely been blocked.

If you've been sending
snaps to each other,
check your chat tab.

If your previous or current
snaps have disappeared,
you may have been blocked.

If you're friends on Snapchat,
check your friends list.
If you no longer see them,

this could be an indication
that they blocked you.
Try searching their username

using the spotlight at
the upper left corner.

If it doesn't appear,
they may have blocked you.
However, keep in mind

that the person you believe
may have blocked you
could have deleted their account.

To confirm, ask a friend
to search their username.

If it shows up on your friend's
account but not your own,
you may have been blocked.
